intro: Patellocalamus, commonly known as the golden grass, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to the arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and South Africa. The plants are characterized by their tall, erect growth and golden-colored inflorescences, which give them their common name. Patellocalamus species are typically perennial and are adapted to survive in dry conditions with minimal water. These grasses play an important role in stabilizing soil and supporting local ecosystems in their native habitats.
